intro: Linociera luzonica, commonly known as the Luzon linociera, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within montane forests. It has small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
